cab.content:
This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.
G.T.6013
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 17TH OCTOBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
On the coast the Belgians have taken LOMBARTZYDE.
The line runs :- OLD FORT, MANNEKENSBERE, LEKE, PRAETBOSCH WOOD, thence as before.
The Fourth Army attacked this morning from LE CATEAU to south-west of BOHAIN, and are reported to have taken LE-PETIT-VERLY, ANDIGNY-LES-FERMES, LA-VALLEE-MULATRE, L'ABRE-DE-GUISE, FARM 2 kms: east of ST. BENIN.
French Front.
The French are reported to have captured MONT D'ORIGNY.
2. ITALIAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
3. BALKAN FRONT.
In SERBIA the French infantry advancing on PIROT have reached TSARIBROD. North of PRISTINA a France-Greek detachment has occupied KURSULTE. Futher west JACOVA has been evacuated by the enemy who has fallen back on IPEK.
North of NISH the Serbians have reached the line BLACA heights, VELIKI, JASTREBAC, RIBARI, DRENOVAC, BUJUNIR.
Numerous prisoners have been taken and 32 guns.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
17th October, 1918.
Issued at 1235.
